data.title: Unesco experts to visit rail project in Ayutthaya soon
data.description: Experts from Unesco

data.title: Phuket cabaret seen as lucrative cash cow
data.description: Phuket cabaret is a "soft power" of the province that can generate over 200 million baht in revenue a year, according to provincial governor Sophon Suwanrat.

data.title: 4 Thais safe after Myanmar navy incident
data.description: Four Thai nationals detained in Myanmar remain safe after their boat allegedly strayed into Myanmar waters in the Andaman Sea on Saturday, the government said yesterday.

data.title: 40% of fathers smoke, survey shows
data.description: Almost four in ten fathers in Thailand smoke cigarettes, which mostly has a negative influence on their children, especially as more young people are now vaping while the average age of people who vape drops each year, according to new survey findings.

data.title: Govt plans new handout for farmers
data.description: The cabinet has approved a new programme to support over four million households which rely on agriculture across the country, which would see about 38.5 billion baht in financial assistance rolled out to replace the fertiliser co-payment scheme that was terminated by the government yesterday.

data.title: Cabinet okays B5bn budget for 16 more provinces
data.description: The cabinet yesterday approved a budget of five billion baht to assist households affected by flooding in 16 additional provinces, with similar payouts made to those previously impacted by floods.

data.title: Welfare boost for 3 vulnerable groups
data.description: Monthly allowance increases for newborn children, elderly and disabled people are expected to be implemented on Oct 1 next year, according to Varawut Silpa-archa, Minister of Social Development and Human Security (MSDHS).

data.title: Farmland to be confiscated
data.description: Agriculture and Cooperatives Minister Narumon Pinyosinwat on Tuesday vowed that the agricultural land found to have been used unlawfully for operating Phu Nub Dao Farm in Saraburi will be confiscated.

data.title: Boonsong release stirs flap
data.description: Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra denied speculation that the release on parole of former commerce minister Boonsong Teriyapirom, who was convicted of corruption in an earlier rice-pledging scheme, would pave the way for the possible return of fugitive ex-premier Yingluck Shinawatra.

data.title: Big haul of bullets seized from illegal migrants
data.description: KANCHANABURI: The arrest of nine  illegal migrants  from  Myanmar  has led to the discovery of almost 3,000  bullets  in a house in Muang district where they were staying, police said on Tuesday.

data.title: Transparency sought in Cambodia talks
data.description: The opposition People’s Party has called on the Thai government to ensure transparency in the appointment of a  joint technical committee  (JTC) to negotiate with  Cambodia  over  disputed maritime areas .

data.title: Rainmaking flights give air quality instant boost
data.description: The  air quality index  (AQI) in Bangkok, its adjacent provinces and some northern provinces has reportedly i mproved  following the first day of  rainmaking flights  by the Department of Royal Rainmaking and Agricultural Aviation (DRRAA).

data.title: Government ‘failing scam victims’
data.description: A Senate committee has blamed the government for failing to protect people from falling victim to investment  fraud  scams such as the one involving Dr   Boon Vanasin  , the founder of Thonburi Healthcare Group.

data.title: Fire guts 'ghost ship' on Koh Chang
data.description: A  fire  aboard an old, abandoned floating hotel known as the " ghost ship " sent black smoke billowing into the sky over the  resort island  of  Koh Chang , off the Trat coast, on Tuesday..

data.title: Cabinet approves 'retirement lotto' bill
data.description: The cabinet has approved a draft law establishing a "retirement lotto" aimed at helping people save the money they spend on purchases of tickets, Deputy Finance Minister Paopoom Rojanasakul said on Tuesday.

data.title: Chinese 'cuck' arrested over rape-sex video with student
data.description: Police have arrested a 33-year-old Chinese man with a  sexual fetish  for the  alleged rape , which he also  videoed , of an 18-year-old university  student  in Bangkok.

data.title: Lawyer given another 2 years for lese-majeste
data.description: The Criminal Court on Tuesday convicted human rights lawyer  Arnon Nampa  of  lese-majeste  and computer crime offences and sentenced him to two years in prison. The ruling brings to 16 years and 2 months the total time he has to serve, according to Thai Lawyers for Human Rights (TLHR).

data.title: Severe flooding in South claims 25 lives
data.description: Severe flooding in the South has claimed 25 lives and affected more than 660,000 households in 10 provinces, with large areas of six provinces still inundated as the water drains slowly off..

data.title: Severe flooding in South has claimed 25 lives
data.description: Severe flooding in the South has claimed 25 lives and affected more than 660,000 households in 10 provinces, with large areas of six provinces still inundated as the water drains slowly off..

data.title: Govt to set up national disaster HQ
data.description: The government has announced plans to establish a national disaster management centre to tackle emergencies amid the ongoing flood crisis which has devastated many parts of the lower South.

data.title: Phumtham downplays MP's House dissolution warning
data.description: Deputy Prime Minister Phumtham Wechayachai dismissed a Pheu Thai MP

data.title: 'Many' suspects in resort land case
data.description: There are many suspects thought to be involved in the case of a luxury resort built on land reserved for landless farmers in Nakhon Ratchasima and Saraburi, said Pol Maj Gen Jaroonkiat Pankaew, deputy commissioner of the Central Investigation Bureau (CIB) yesterday.

data.title: Yingluck next for return?
data.description: The release on parole of former commerce minister Boonsong Teriyapirom, who was convicted of corruption in the rice-pledging scheme, has heightened speculation about a possible return of fugitive former prime minister Yingluck Shinawatra.

data.title: Major push to attract foreign universities
data.description: The Ministry of Higher Education, Science, Research and Innovation plans to invite prestigious universities from overseas to open campuses in Thailand in a bid to make the country a regional education hub.

data.title: Lecturer's death sparks probe
data.description: Songkhla: An investigation is underway to find out who should be held responsible for the death of Narun Nattharom, a university lecturer, who was electrocuted at his home in Hat Yai district while closing his front gate in waist-high floodwater.

data.title: Dept vows quick payouts for victims' kin
data.description: The Department of Highways (DoH) has promised to quickly compensate the families of those killed in last week

data.title: Authorities uncover illegal  transmission cables in Tak
data.description: Authorities have uncovered large-scale illegal telephone and internet signal transmission cables in Tak

data.title: Govt gears up for new law
data.description: The state and civil sectors are gearing up to implement the Marriage Equality Bill, which is set to become law next month.

data.title: Ambassador told to push for quick release of Thai fishing crew
data.description: Thailand has urged the Myanmar ambassador to push for the immediate release of the four Thai citizens who are currently detained in the neighbouring country after their boat came under fire from Myanmar navy ships off the coast of Ranong last week.

data.title: UAE keen to boost Thai ties
data.description: The United Arab Emirates is gearing up to sign several bilateral agreements with Thailand in an effort to strengthen ties between the two countries, said UAE ambassador to Thailand, Obaid Saeed Obaid Bintaresh Aldhaheri.

data.title: Phumtham downplays MP's House dissolution warning
data.description: Deputy Prime Minister Phumtham Wechayachai dismissed a Pheu Thai MP

data.title: Yingluck next for return?
data.description: The release on parole of former commerce minister Boonsong Teriyapirom, who was convicted of corruption in the rice-pledging scheme, has heightened speculation about a possible return of fugitive former prime minister Yingluck Shinawatra.

data.title: Thailand's biggest call scam centre boss arrested near Cambodia
data.description: Police on Monday arrested a Chinese man suspected of heading Thailand

data.title: Thailand, Malaysia brace for fresh wave of floods as water levels ease
data.description: KUALA LUMPUR/BANGKOK -  Malaysia  and  Thailand  are facing a second wave of heavy rain and  potential flooding  this week, authorities said on Monday, even as some displaced residents were able to return home and the worst floods in decades began receding in some areas.
